title: ASPI Note: Understanding China's Sixth Plenum
description: What to know about the Chinese Communist Party's recent plenary event.

title: China and the U.S. Agree To 'Enhance Ambition' on Climate. Here's What This Means
description: ASPI's Thom Woodroofe writes that while the agreement isn't a "game changer," it still represents a step forward given the state of the U.S.-China relationship.

title: China’s Prospects for Joining the CPTPP
description: Wendy Cutler and Bonnie Glaser on the China Global podcast.

title: Is the Future Regional?
description: Wendy Cutler with Rem Korteweg, Martin Sandbu, and James Crabtree on the AIG Global Trade Series podcast.

title: A Trade Pact Faces a Crucial Test as China and Taiwan Try to Join
description: Wendy Cutler writes in Barron's about China and Taiwan's intentions to join the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP).

title: Understanding Evergrande
description: Kevin Rudd's remarks on the implications of Evergrande for the Chinese and global economies, Xi Jinping’s political economy, and systemic financial risk.

title: Wendy Cutler on China, Taiwan, and the CPTPP
description: Wendy Cutler speaks with The Diplomat about next steps and broader implications of China and Taiwan's bids to join the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP).

title: China Wants to Join the Trade Pact Once Designed to Counter It
description: Wendy Cutler writes in Foreign Policy about China's bid to join the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP).

title: America Must Return to the Trans-Pacific Partnership
description: Wendy Cutler writes in Foreign Affairs about the need for the Biden Administration to re-engage with the Trans-Pacific Partnership.

title: Xi Jinping's Pivot to the State
description: Kevin Rudd's remarks on the impact of ideology, demography, and decoupling on China’s new economic policy framework

title: Kevin Rudd Remarks to a Chinese People's Institute of Foreign Affairs Virtual Seminar
description: Kevin Rudd delivered remarks in mandarin to a virtual seminar hosted by the Chinese People's Institute of Foreign Affairs.

title: Ideological Competition With China Is Inevitable — Like It or Not
description: Nathan Levine writes in Foreign Policy about the inevitable ideological competition between China and the U.S.

title: Why the Quad Alarms China
description: Kevin Rudd writes that the Quad's success poses a major threat to Beijing's ambitions.

title: China’s Carbon Market Launch: Foundations, First Impressions and Future
description: Jackson Ewing, Environmental Defense Fund's Xiaolu Zhao, and SinoCarbon's Zhibin Chen discuss what China's just-launched emissions trading scheme will mean for climate change.

title: The Biden Administration & U.S.-Australia Cooperation
description: Wendy Cutler is interviewed by Gordon Flake on the Biden Administration's Indo-Pacific trade policy and areas for collaboration between U.S. and Australia, among other issues.

title: Kurt Campbell: U.S. and China Can Co-Exist Peacefully
description: The White House coordinator for the Indo-Pacific described the "enormously difficult" Sino-American relationship in a conversation with Kevin Rudd, Wendy Cutler, and Daniel Russel.
